Introduction

Here we have listed some of our favorite places in Seoul so make sure to check them out. Please let us know if you have any questions or need more recommendations. We are more than happy to share our opinion with you. Hope youâ€™ll have a wonderful time in Seoul â˜€

Hyunjin and Jakob, 2023

Restaurants

1. ì‚¬ëŒ€ë¶€ì§‘ ê³³ê°„ (Sadebujip Gotkan)

Please go here! Our favorite restaurant. This building is known as a sustainable building, having solar panels surrounding the entire building, as well as having a rooftop garden. You can enjoy authentic Korean traditional food with a side dish salad bar on the 55th floor. You can also drop by The Hyundai department store after having lunch/dinner here ğŸ™‚

Recommend menu: ì „ë³µê°ˆë¹„ì°œ 60,000 won Link: https://naver.me/5Tv3uNTp

2. í™©ìƒê°€ ì¹¼êµ­ìˆ˜ (Hwangsenga Kalguksu)

ì¹¼êµ­ìˆ˜ (Kalguksu) is Korean traditional food made in a husmanskost style that people eat as everyday food. It is similar to Udon but using a beef broth. This restaurant is listed in the Michelin guide as an affordable restaurant where one dish costs around 11,000 krw. Even if you go there as one person, I would like to recommend eat two dishes which are noodle and dumpling. It is like a set in Korea to eat ì¹¼êµ­ìˆ˜ noodle together with Kimchi and dumpling. Recommend menu: ì‚¬ê³¨ì¹¼êµ­ìˆ˜ (Sagul Kalguksu) 11,000 won, ì™•ë§Œë‘(Wangmandu) 11,000 won together as a set. Link: https://m.place.naver.com/share?id=11679429&tabsPath=/home&appMode=detail

3. ë§˜ìŠ¤í„°ì¹˜ (Momâ€™s Touch)

We know it sounds weird. Hyunjinâ€™s favorite student food. It is a really tasty hamburger franchise. I love chicken burgers and it is impossible to find a chicken burger as good as this one in Stockholm. If you want to have just McDonald's, then please rather go here. They have many different locations all over Seoul. ğŸ™‚

Recommend menu: ì‹¸ì´ë²„ê±° (thigh burger) 6,900 won Location: Anywhere close to you

4. êµì´Œì¹˜í‚¨(Kyochon Chicken)

This is the best chicken delivery place. My favorite menu is Honey Combo ğŸ˜ƒ

5. ëª©ë©±ì‚°ë°© ë‚¨ì‚°íƒ€ì›Œì 

One of the best places in Seoul to get a traditional bibimbap The restaurant is inside an old temple on the Namsan mountain where you can also get a beautiful view of the city. The price is surprisingly affordable for the high quality food and amazing location. Recommended menu: Bulgogi bibimbap (12,500 won)

Link: https://naver.me/5EUY1Xne

3. ì„¤ë¹™ (Sarbing)

Korean traditional dessert place for íŒ¥ë¹™ìˆ˜ (Packpingsu). íŒ¥ë¹™ìˆ˜ (Packpingsu) is Korean style ice cream which is basically sliced ice with red bean paste. ì„¤ë¹™ (Sarbing) offers more modern variations popular with young people. They have tastes like Mango ë¹™ìˆ˜, Strawberry ë¹™ìˆ˜, etc.ğŸ™‚

Places to Visit

1. ë” í˜„ëŒ€ (The Hyundai Department Store)

The Hyundai Department Store is the go-to place for shopping in Seoul. This place has been open for a few years and quickly become the go-to place for shopping, especially for people in their 20s and 30s. They have a variety of stores and not only for clothes but also itâ€™s really fun to look around the huge food section. Highly recommend visiting here, especially B1 where there are a lot of food stores and B2 where there are a lot of pop-up stores. Vezzly is Jakobâ€™s favorite bakery located in The Hyundai. His favorite is a fika bread called â€˜ë©œë¡ ë¹µ(Melon pang)â€™ ğŸ™‚

Recommend stores: Vezzly (bakery), Andar (unisex clothing) Link: https://m.place.naver.com/share?id=1386302181&tabsPath=/home&appMode=detail

2. ì¸ì™•ì‚° (Inwang san mountain)

This is a place Jakob went for hiking. You get a really good view over Seoul. As far as I remember, I hiked through Inwangsan section which is the purple color in the map below. The section starting from the site of Donuimun and passing through Woram Neighborhood Park and Inwangsan Sunseong-gil to Changuimun Gate. Link: https://naver.me/5eGTvcXC

3. ë„í† ë¦¬ ìºë¦¬ì»¤ì³ (Acorn Caricature)

Cute small store where they draw your pictures. They draw you in a few minutes for only 7,000 won. Unfortunately, Jakob does not look at all like what they drew, but it's a fun experience you can have at an affordable price. ğŸ™‚

Price: 7,000 won Link: https://m.place.naver.com/share?id=1663897441&tabsPath=%2Fhome&appMode=detail

Touristy Places

1. êµ­ë¦½ ì¤‘ì•™ ë°•ë¬¼ê´€ (National museum)

Great museum which covers the history of Korea. ğŸ™‚

Link: https://naver.me/5eGTvcXC

2. ì „ìŸ ê¸°ë…ê´€ (The war memorial of Korea)

Well-made museum, mainly about the Korean war. Recommend the guided tour in English. You can check out tanks, flights and many different items that were used in the war. Link: https://naver.me/5PS2bSN8

3. ê²½ë³µê¶ (Gyeongbokgung Place)

The main palace. If you plan to visit any palace this should be your top priority. ğŸ™‚

Link: https://naver.me/FLBKTWSB

4. êµ­ë¦½í˜„ëŒ€ë¯¸ìˆ ê´€ ì„œìš¸ (National Museum of Modern and Contemporary art)

Modern Art museum. Some of the exhibitions are free, so good to check out. The stores inside and cafe (Terarosa) are nice so have a quick sneak peek when you are walking by. Link: https://naver.me/5eGTvcXC

5. Everland (w. Caribbean Bay)

Everland is the largest theme park in Korea, a place I spend a lot of good time during my youthful years with my friends and family. There are both rides and an zoo in Everland and right beside it lies Caribbean Bay, a water park. It's possible to buy a single ticket for access to both parks. I would like to recommend try hop on a safari bus for an up-close look at lions, bears, and giraffes! Recommend rides: TìµìŠ¤í”„ë ˆìŠ¤(T Express), ì‚¬íŒŒë¦¬ ì›”ë“œ(Safari World), ë¡œìŠ¤íŠ¸ ë²¨ë¦¬(Lost Valley)

6. ë¦¬ì›€ë¯¸ìˆ ê´€

One of our favorite art museums in Seoul. It is owned by Samsungs chair man who had a great interest in art, and it contains pieces from his private collection. It is considered one of the best private art museums in Korea.

Link:

Good to Know

Naver Maps

Koreans donâ€™t use Google Maps. There is not as much information available on Google Maps, especially if youâ€™re looking for a review. Also, the maps in Google Maps are not updated frequently due to national safety reasons. We recommend using Naver Maps if you are searching for anything. Link to Naver Map:

Kakao taxi

Uber but Korean version. Uber is not available but Kakao taxi is the most common way to catch taxi ğŸ˜Š Link to app store:
Airalo App for ESim. Jakob bought an e-sim card from the app. Good price, easy to use not only for Korea but also anywhere abroad.
